results.title: Rick and Morty
results.creator_credit: Sydney Ryan, Steve Levy, Nick Rutherford, Albro Lundy IV, Anne Lane, J. Michael Mendel, Lee Harting, Green Portal Productions, Williams Street, Harmonius Claptrap, Justin Roiland's Solo Vanity Card Productions and Starburns Industries
results.brief_description: Rick is a mentally-unbalanced but scientifically gifted old man who has recently reconnected with his family. He spends most of his time involving his young grandson Morty in dangerous, outlandish adventures throughout space and alternate universes. Compounded with Morty’s already unstable family life, these events cause Morty much distress at home and school.

constellations_other.name: Webwurlds
constellations_other.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sydney Ryan, Steve Levy, Nick Rutherford, Albro Lundy IV, Anne Lane, J. Michael Mendel, Lee Harting, Green Portal Productions, Williams Street, Harmonius Claptrap, Justin Roiland’s Solo Vanity Card Productions and Starburns Industries

results.title: Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story
results.brief_description: This six-part docuseries focuses on the killing of unarmed Florida teenager Trayvon Martin, whose killer was allowed to go free after he claimed self defense.
results.title_for_label: Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story

results.title: Reprisal
results.creator_credit: The Littlefield Company and A+E Studios
results.brief_description: A hyper-noir story that follows a relentless femme fatale who, after being left for dead, sets out to take revenge against her brother and his bombastic gang of gear-heads.
results.description: A hyper-noir story that follows a relentless femme fatale who, after being left for dead, sets out to take revenge against her brother and his bombastic gang of gear-heads.
description_for_label: A hyper-noir story that follows a relentless femme fatale who, after being left for dead, sets out to take revenge against her brother and his bombastic gang of gear-heads.

results.title: Repeat Performance
results.creator_credit: Aubrey Schenck Productions, Bryan Foy Productions, Aubrey Schenck, Alfred L. Werker and Walter Bullock
results.brief_description: On New Year’s Eve 1946, Broadway actress Sheila Page apparently callously shoots dead her husband Barney. As she leaves the crime scene, she wishes she could play the year over with a different script. - Wikipedia

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Aubrey Schenck Productions, Bryan Foy Productions, Aubrey Schenck, Alfred L. Werker and Walter Bullock
results.description: Broadway star, Sheila Page, shoots Barney, her murderous husband on New Year’s Eve. She flees her apartment and goes to her producer, John Friday. When she arrives, it is New Year’s day, a year earlier. She has been given the chance to live life over and correct the errors of the past only to find that the end will be the same although the path will be different.
description_for_label: Broadway star, Sheila Page, shoots Barney, her murderous husband on New Year’s Eve. She flees her apartment and goes to her producer, John Friday. When she arrives, it is New Year’s day, a year earlier. She has been given the chance to live life over and correct the errors of the past only to find that the end will be the same although the path will be different.

results.title: Rebecca
results.brief_description: Story of a young woman who marries a fascinating widower only to find out that she must live in the shadow of his former wife, Rebecca, who died mysteriously several years earlier.

constellations_other.name: The Hatfield House rules
constellations_other.description: The shooting location of The Favourite, Hatfield House, has appeared in a number of other iconic works.

results.description: Story of a young woman who marries a fascinating widower only to find out that she must live in the shadow of his former wife, Rebecca, who died mysteriously several years earlier. The young wife must come to grips with the terrible secret of her handsome, cold husband, Max De Winter. She must also deal with the jealous, obsessed Mrs. Danvers, the housekeeper, who will not accept her as the mistress of the house.
description_for_label: Story of a young woman who marries a fascinating widower only to find out that she must live in the shadow of his former wife, Rebecca, who died mysteriously several years earlier. The young wife must come to grips with the terrible secret of her handsome, cold husband, Max De Winter. She must also deal with the jealous, obsessed Mrs. Danvers, the housekeeper, who will not accept her as the mistress of the house.

results.title: Reality Bites
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Jersey Films, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Ben Stiller, Sharon Seymour, Helen Childress and Eugenie Bafaloukos
results.brief_description: A small circle of friends suffering from post-collegiate blues must confront the hard truth about life, love and the pursuit of gainful employment. As they struggle to map out survival guides for the future, the Gen-X quartet soon begins to realize that reality isn’t all it’s cracked up to be.

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, Jersey Films, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Ben Stiller, Sharon Seymour, Helen Childress and Eugenie Bafaloukos

results.title: Ready Player One
results.creator_credit: Adam Stockhausen, Dan Farah, Kristie Macosko, Ernest Cline, Kasia Walicka-Maimone, Donald De Line, Zak Penn, Steven Spielberg, Village Roadshow Pictures, Reliance Entertainment, Farah Films & Management, Dune Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, De Line Pictures and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: When the creator of a popular video game system dies, a virtual contest is created to compete for his fortune.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Adam Stockhausen, Dan Farah, Kristie Macosko, Ernest Cline, Kasia Walicka-Maimone, Donald De Line, Zak Penn, Steven Spielberg, Village Roadshow Pictures, Reliance Entertainment, Farah Films & Management, Dune Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, De Line Pictures and Amblin Entertainment

results.title: Ralph Breaks the Internet
results.creator_credit: Ami Thompson, Phil Johnston, Rich Moore and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Video game bad guy Ralph and fellow misfit Vanellope von Schweetz must risk it all by traveling to the World Wide Web in search of a replacement part to save Vanellope’s video game, Sugar Rush. In way over their heads, Ralph and Vanellope rely on the citizens of the internet — the netizens — to help navigate their way, including an entrepreneur named Yesss, who is the head algorithm and the heart and soul of trend-making site BuzzzTube.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ami Thompson, Phil Johnston, Rich Moore and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.description:
When Wreck-It Ralph was released in 2012, audiences were introduced to the loveable videogame villain and real-life good guy Ralph and the sweet, speed-racing sprite Vanellope von Schweetz. Both ostracised in their game worlds – Ralph because he’s the bad guy in an 8-bit arcade game, Fix-It Felix Jr., and Vanellope because her erratic glitching makes her game, Sugar Rush, unstable – the two form a friendship that propels them through Mr. Litwak’s arcade games on an adventure to accept themselves and win a friendship like no other.

Voiced by comedians John C. Reilly and Sarah Silverman respectively, the two characters guided audiences through a neon nostalgia trip into the arcade era and helped the film score at the box office. Aside from the Academy Award and Golden Globe nominations for Best Animated Film, Disney’s 52nd animated film won the Annie Award for Best Animated Feature and led to one of Walt Disney Animation Studios’ rare theatrical sequels (there are only five), Ralph Breaks the Internet (2018).

In the sequel, Ralph and Vanellope journey into the newly introduced internet on a quest to find a replacement steering wheel for Sugar Rush before the arcade owner, Mr. Litwak, retires the broken game and leaves Vanellope homeless. In their adventures, Ralph becomes a viral video sensation on BuzzTube, while Vanellope finds a hero in Shank (Gal Gadot), the tough-as-nails matriarch of gritty online racing game Slaughter Race.

In the pictured concept art, a digital painting by Ami Thompson, Ralph and Vanellope’s spirit of adventure and friendship is on full display, with Penelope directing Ralph onwards and upwards, but as the two adjust to the internet in Ralph Breaks the Internet, their friendship will be tested, evolve and they’ll once again learn more about themselves than they could’ve ever imagined alone.
description_for_label:

results.title: Q&A
results.brief_description: Hosted by Hamish Macdonald, Q&A puts punters, pollies and pundits together in the studio to thrash out the hot issues of the week. It’s about democracy in action - the audience gets to ask the questions.
results.description: Hosted by Hamish Macdonald, Q&A puts punters, pollies and pundits together in the studio to thrash out the hot issues of the week. It’s about democracy in action - the audience gets to ask the questions.

results.title: Pushing Daisies
results.brief_description: A pie-maker, with the power to bring dead people back to life, solves murder mysteries with his alive-again childhood sweetheart, a cynical private investigator, and a lovesick waitress.

constellations_other.name: Flower on the wind
constellations_other.description: Explore the use of flowers in the moving image as an aesthetic and metaphor.

results.description: A pie-maker, with the power to bring dead people back to life, solves murder mysteries with his alive-again childhood sweetheart, a cynical private investigator, and a lovesick waitress.
